Wisdom: الْعَالِمُ مَنْ شَهِدَتْ بِصِحَّةِ أَقْوَالِهِ أَفْعَالُهُ
enWisdom: The scholar is one whose actions attest to the veracity of his words

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ مَقْرُونٌ بِالْعَمَلِ فَمَنْ عَلِمَ عَمِلَ
enWisdom: Knowledge is linked to action, so one who knows, acts

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ يَهْتِفُ بِالْعَمَلِ فَإِنْ أَجَابَهُ وَإِلَّا ارْتَحَلَ
enWisdom: Knowledge calls out to action, so if it responds to it [then it stays] otherwise it departs

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ يُرْشِدُكَ وَالْعَمَلُ يَبْلُغُ بِكَ الْغَايَةَ
enWisdom: Knowledge guides you and action takes you to the goal

Wisdom: اعْمَلْ بِالْعِلْمِ تُدْرِكْ غُنْماً
enWisdom: Act upon [your] knowledge and you will attain [great] benefit

Wisdom: أَطِعِ الْعِلْمَ وَاعْصِ الْجَهْلَ تُفْلِحْ
enWisdom: Obey knowledge and disobey ignorance, [for by doing this] you will be successful

Wisdom: اعْمَلُوا بِالْعِلْمِ تَسْعَدُوا
enWisdom: Act upon [your] knowledge and you will be felicitous

Wisdom: اطْلُبُوا الْعِلْمَ تُعْرَفُوا بِهِ وَاعْمَلُوا بِهِ تَكُونُوا مِنْ أَهْلِهِ
enWisdom: Gain knowledge and you will be known by it, act upon it and you will be one of its worthy possessors

Wisdom: أَنْفَعُ الْعِلْمِ مَا عُمِلَ بِهِ
enWisdom: The most useful knowledge is that which is acted upon

Wisdom: أَحْسَنُ الْعِلْمِ مَا كَانَ مَعَ الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: The most honourable knowledge is that which is manifested in the organs and limbs

Wisdom: أَشْرَفُ الْعِلْمِ مَا ظَهَرَ فِي الْجَوَارِحِ وَالْأَرْكَانِ
enWisdom: The lowliest knowledge is that which stops at the tongue [and is not acted upon]

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الذَّخَائِرِ عِلْمٌ يُعْمَلُ بِهِ [عُمِلَ بِهِ‏] وَمَعْرُوفٌ لَا يُمَنُّ بِهِ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: أَوْجَبُ الْعِلْمِ عَلَيْكَ مَا أَنْتَ مَسْئُولٌ عَنِ الْعَمَلِ بِهِ
enWisdom: The most obligatory knowledge for you [to acquire] is that which you are responsible for acting upon

Wisdom: أَحْمَدُ الْعِلْمِ عَاقِبَةً مَا زَادَ فِي عَمَلِكَ فِي الْعَاجِلِ وَأَزْلَفَكَ فِي الْآجِلِ
enWisdom: Verily the best of knowledge is [that which leads to] tranquillity and forbearance

Wisdom: إِذَا رُمْتُمُ الِانْتِفَاعَ بِالْعِلْمِ فَاعْمَلُوا بِهِ وَأَكْثِرُوا الْفِكْرَ فِي مَعَانِيهِ تَعِهِ الْقُلُوبُ
enWisdom: When the knowledge of a person increases, his etiquette improves and his awe for his Lord increases

Wisdom: تَمَامُ الْعِلْمِ اسْتِعْمَالُهُ
enWisdom: The completeness of knowledge is [in] acting according to it

Wisdom: تَمَامُ الْعِلْمِ الْعَمَلُ بِمُوجِبِهِ
enWisdom: The one who forsakes acting on [his] knowledge is not certain of getting reward for his action

Wisdom: تَعَلَّمُوا الْعِلْمَ تُعْرَفُوا بِهِ وَاعْمَلُوا بِهِ تَكُونُوا مِنْ أَهْلِهِ
enWisdom: Gain knowledge and you will be known by it, act upon it and you will be one of its worthy possessors

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْعِلْمِ الْعَمَلُ بِهِ
enWisdom: The fruit of knowledge is working for [a blissful] life [in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْعِلْمِ الْعَمَلُ لِلْحَيَاةِ
enWisdom: The fruit of knowledge is sincerity of action

Wisdom: جَمَالُ الْعَالِمِ عَمَلُهُ بِعِلْمِهِ
enWisdom: The beauty of a scholar is [in] his acting upon his knowledge

Wisdom: عَلَى الْعَالِمِ أَنْ يَعْمَلَ بِمَا عَلِمَ ثُمَّ يَطْلُبَ تَعَلُّمَ مَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ
enWisdom: It is the duty of the scholar to act upon what he knows and then seek to learn that which he does not know

Wisdom: مَنْ خَالَفَ عِلْمَهُ عَظُمَتْ جَرِيمَتُهُ وَإِثْمُهُ
enWisdom: One whose knowledge exceeds his intellect, it becomes a burden for him

Wisdom: مِنْ كَمَالِ الْعِلْمِ الْعَمَلُ بِمَا يَقْتَضِيهِ
enWisdom: From the most honourable of knowledge is self-adornment with forbearance

Wisdom: مِنْ فَضْلِ عِلْمِكَ اسْتِقْلَالُكَ لِعِلْمِكَ [مِنْ أَفْضَلِ الْعِلْمِ اسْتِقْلَالُكَ بِعَمَلِكَ‏]
enWisdom: Considering your knowledge (or action) as little is from the excellence of your knowledge
